Description: Scarab carved from stone; underside incised with very stylised sistrum in the shape of Hathor head with cow ears and horns.
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII, no. 154). An identical Hathor's head, but represented with addorsed red crown, was discovered on another stone scarab discovered in Naukratis: Bristol, City Art Gallery & Museum H5115.8. Very stylised head of Hathor such as this one is characteristic of the Middle Kingdom and Second Intermediate Period scarabs (see for example: Tufnell 1984, 120, class 3B3b, pl. XII and 138, class 10D, pl. XLVIII). Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Tufnell, O. 1984, Studies on Scarab Seals, II: Scarab Seals and their Contribution to History in the Early Second Millennium BC, Warminster.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVIII, no. 154)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.19) (phase 3)
